result.execSummary:
The defendant Raheem Demoney Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 4 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked in case 15CF1116, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court allows dosage probation.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 01/08/2015 at 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem Demoney Winston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  Court allows dosage probation.

Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 01/08/2015 at 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked in case 15CF1116, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Ineligible Voting Notice received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense attorney is in trial in another branch.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Motion hearing, however defense withdraws motion hearing and requests a projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's motion to join cases for trial, received and filed.  aw
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed on 5/27/2015.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests a motion date.  State has filed a motion to join all three cases for trial.  Court stated Judge Witkowiak will rule on the joinder motion. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  A substitution was previously filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts for the next court date.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 8/24/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 22.  aw
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed. aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel wants a motion date.  Defense to talk with client more to see how he wants to proceed on his pending cases.  State to file a motion to join defendant's three cases for trial.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Defendant to make all contacts with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lin has been appointed.  Case adjourned to see how defendant wants to proceed on all three cases.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
No attorney has been appointed yet for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 5/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel is retiring in June and requests to withdraw and have new counsel appointed.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 5/1/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Court is in trial.  Case set for motion hearing.  State is in trial, and unable to do the motion.  Defendant has two other pending cases.  Defense counsel is retiring and will have to withdraw from the case.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 4/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's response to defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a DISPOSITIVE MOTION.  State to respond by 3/24/2015.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 4/7/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.   Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw
  Motion hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of motion and motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw
Court orders defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for defense to file a motion.  Case adjourned for 2/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Alex Mueller for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  
Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in custody.  
Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
